results.title: Indigeneous Australians: an Aboriginal community focus
results.creator_credit: Monitor Interactive and New South Wales. Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: An interactive CD-ROM from TAFE which is the first to draw on the comprehensive knowledge and expertise of Aboriginal community members and is an invaluable teaching resource. The concept behind this CD-ROM is to let members of various Aboriginal Communities become teachers of their rich culture. A resource guide accompanies the CD-ROM. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: This CD-ROM is compatible on both Macintosh and IBM compatible PC’s.

results.title: Witness to Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Robin Taylor and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This program describes the events behind the gates of Auschwitz using archival footage and photographs. This program documents the experiences of Rudolph Verba, one of the few to escape Auschwitz and co-author the report which unveiled the horror of the Nazi work camps.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, Reel Images and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.

results.title: Martin Luther King: The Legacy
results.brief_description: An excellent documentary which not only looks at the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King, but at how his dream for an integrated United States has been realised today. Interviews with participants of the Civil Rights Movement, friends and family of Dr. King and those who sought to destroy him such as the FBI. As well as fascinating archival footage, there is also an excellent soundtrack which features Afro-american music contemporary to the era.

results.title: Beau Geste
results.creator_credit: Douglas Camfield, Barry Letts and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: From the novel by P.C. Wren, “Beau Geste” is the adventures of three aristocratic British brothers who turn their backs on their privileged lives and join the French Foreign Legion. Drawn together by the ties of blood and loyalty, their courage and honour are tested in the harsh desert world. This is another excellent BBC adaptation and stars Benedict Taylor as Beau Geste, Anthony Calf as Digby and Johnathon Morris as John.

results.title: Dealing with difficult people
results.brief_description: The aim of this video-based training program is to inform participants about four fundamental techniques which will enable them to deal with difficult people. The techniques can be applied to everyday contexts within the home and workplace. A manual which complements the video can be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: The Genie from downunder. - Vol. 6.
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jeremy Swan, Patricia Edgar, Phil Jones and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: In “Triple treat”, confusion reigns supreme when Conrad and Otto make two replica’s of Penelope’s magic opal. There’s lots of opal rubbing but little magic as a result! Bruce finally gets the opal back to the cave in “It’s still magic” and is about to free himself when Penelope and Baz accuse him of selfishness. Eventually some sort of compromise is reached and Bruce finds out about the magic of romance.

results.title: Customer service
results.brief_description: The aim of this manual is to present knowledge and techniques required to develop and maintain on-going service to customers and to convert complaints into appointments to further strengthen customer ties. A video which complements this manual may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.

results.title: Live & or let die
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Best of Lateline”.
This lateline program examines the issues surrounding the legalisation of euthanasia. The first portion of the program looks at the situation in Holland where euthanasia is decriminalised. The second portion of the program is a panel discussion between 3 doctors who present a range of opinions on this topic. The video includes Teacher’s Notes. No other credits available.
